sections.heading: Fast and Easy GST Registration for Your Business
content: You can get your GSTIN (Goods and Services Tax Identification Number) and register for GST completely online.
GST registration allows you to legally collect GST, issue GST-compliant invoices, and claim input tax credit.

sections.heading: What is GST Registration?
content: GST registration is mandatory for businesses that cross certain turnover limits or fall under specified categories.
After successful registration, your business receives a unique GSTIN which enables lawful tax compliance.

sections.heading: GST Registration Threshold Limits
content: Understanding turnover limits is important to know when GST registration becomes mandatory.

rows: ₹40 Lakhs (₹20 Lakhs for special category states)

sections.heading: Who Should Register for GST?
content: GST registration is compulsory for the following categories of businesses.

points: Service providers operating across state borders
Casual taxable persons and Non-Resident Taxable Persons (NRTPs)

sections.heading: Documents Required for GST Registration
content: The documents required depend on the type of business entity.

list.title: For Partnership, Company, or LLP
points: Proof of principal place of business

sections.heading: How to Register for GST
content: Our simple process ensures fast and hassle-free GST registration.

sections.heading: Processing Time
content: GST registration is typically completed within 3 to 7 working days once all documents are verified.

sections.heading: Benefits of GST Registration
content: GST registration offers multiple financial and compliance advantages for businesses.

points: Claim input tax credit and reduce tax burden
Eligibility to apply for government tenders
Avoid penalties, notices, and compliance issues
Improved credibility with banks, vendors, and clients

list.title: Do all businesses need GST registration?
points: No, registration is required only after crossing prescribed turnover limits, except for mandatory categories like e-commerce sellers and interstate suppliers.

list.title: How long does GST registration take?
points: GST registration usually takes 3 to 7 business days after document submission.

list.title: Is GST registration completely online?
points: Yes, the entire process is conducted online through the GST portal.

list.title: What is a GSTIN?
points: GSTIN is a unique 15-digit identification number issued to every registered taxpayer.

list.title: Can GST registration be cancelled later?
points: Yes, GST registration can be cancelled if business operations are discontinued or turnover falls below limits.
